intro: Uroskinnera hirtiflora var. breviloba, commonly known as the short-stalked hirtiflora, is a rare and unique plant species characterized by its compact growth habit and distinctive floral morphology. It features small, hairy leaves that are typically arranged in a dense rosette, which helps it retain moisture in its native arid environment. The flowers are usually pink to purple in color, with a short peduncle, giving it its specific variety name "breviloba." It is native to specific regions in southern Africa, where it thrives in rocky soils and dry conditions. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a vulnerable species in its native range.
